=?ISO-2022-JP?B?GyRCI1IjZRsoQjpPSxskQiRHGyhC?=
 =?ISO-2022-JP?B?GyRCJDkbKEI=?=
body: From imperfect exercise of justice in this world we cannot infer its perfect exercise in a future world, 109; we must regulate our conduct solely by the experienced train of events, 110; in case of human works of art we can infer the perfect from the imperfect, but that is because we know man by experience and also know other instances of his art, 111-112; but in the case of God we only know him by his productions, and do not know any class of beings to which he belongs, 113; and the universe, his production, is entirely singular and does not belong to a known species of things, 115.
